intro: Galarhoeus austrinus, commonly known as the southern galarhoeus, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the southern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale yellow, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Galarhoeus austrinus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
